text: ਸਭੋ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਹੁਕਮੁ ਹੈ ਆਪੇ ਨਿਰਭਉ ਸਮਤੁ ਬੀਚਾਰੀ ॥੩॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He Himself is the Commander; all are under His Command. The Fearless Lord looks on all alike. ||3||

transliteration.text: sabhō hukam hukam hai āpē nirabhau samat bīchārī .3.

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

text: ਜੋ ਜਨ ਜਾਨਿ ਭਜਹਿ ਪੁਰਖੋਤਮੁ ਤਾ ਚੀ ਅਬਿਗਤੁ ਬਾਣੀ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: That humble being who knows, and meditates on the Supreme Primal Being - his word becomes eternal.

transliteration.text: jō jan jān bhajah purakhōtam tā chī abigat bānī .

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

text: ਨਾਮਾ ਕਹੈ ਜਗਜੀਵਨੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਹਿਰਦੈ ਅਲਖ ਬਿਡਾਣੀ ॥੪॥੧॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Naam Dayv, I have found the Invisible, Wondrous Lord, the Life of the World, within my heart. ||4||1||

transliteration.text: nāmā kahai jagajīvan pāiā hiradai alakh bidānī .4.1.

translation.text: Prabhaatee:

text: ਆਦਿ ਜੁਗਾਦਿ ਜੁਗਾਦਿ ਜੁਗੋ ਜੁਗੁ ਤਾ ਕਾ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਨਿਆ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He existed in the beginning, in the primeval age, and all throughout the ages; His limits cannot be known.

transliteration.text: ād jugād jugād jugō jug tā kā ant n jāniā .

text: ਸਰਬ ਨਿਰੰਤਰਿ ਰਾਮੁ ਰਹਿਆ ਰਵਿ ਐਸਾ ਰੂਪੁ ਬਖਾਨਿਆ ॥੧॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Lord is pervading and permeating amongst all; this is how His Form can be described. ||1||

transliteration.text: sarab nirantar rām rahiā rav aisā rūp bakhāniā .1.

translation.text: My Lord is the Embodiment of Bliss. ||1||Pause||

text: ਬਾਵਨ ਬੀਖੂ ਬਾਨੈ ਬੀਖੇ ਬਾਸੁ ਤੇ ਸੁਖ ਲਾਗਿਲਾ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The beautiful fragrance of sandalwood emanates from the sandalwood tree, and attaches to the other trees of the forest.

transliteration.text: bāvan bīkhū bānai bīkhē bās tē sukh lāgilā .

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: God, the Primal Source of everything, is like the sandalwood tree; He transforms us woody trees into fragrant sandalwood. ||2||

transliteration.text: sarabē ād paramalād kāsat chandan bhaiilā .2.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You, O Lord, are the Philosopher's Stone, and I am iron; associating with You, I am transformed into gold.

author.author: Saint Beni
author.description:
Saint Beni [15th - 16th Century] was a Hindu mystic whose teachings have been incorporated in the Guru Granth Sahib. It is believed he spent most of his time in prayer and meditation, and often neglected his household needs - so God himself intervened and physically appeared to help him several times.

Saint Beni has three hymns in the Guru Granth Sahib marked by an intense spiritual longing. They also indicate the various paths tried by him in his quest, his practical experience of life and his mastery of religious lore of diverse traditions.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But you hold a knife in the hand of your heart.

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

author.description:
Saint Beni [15th - 16th Century] was a Hindu mystic whose teachings have been incorporated in the Guru Granth Sahib. It is believed he spent most of his time in prayer and meditation, and often neglected his household needs - so God himself intervened and physically appeared to help him several times.

Saint Beni has three hymns in the Guru Granth Sahib marked by an intense spiritual longing. They also indicate the various paths tried by him in his quest, his practical experience of life and his mastery of religious lore of diverse traditions.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You look like a thug; pretending to meditate, you pose like a crane.

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You try to look like a Vaishnaav, but the breath of life escapes through your mouth. ||1||

melody.description: The emotions conveyed in Parbhati are those of extreme devotion; there is an intense confidence and love for the entity it is devoted to. This affection arises from knowledge, common sense and a detailed study. There is therefore an understanding and a considered will to devote itself to that entity.

translation.text: You pray for hours to God the Beautiful.

text: ਕ੍ਰੂਰ ਦਿਸਟਿ ਰਤਾ ਨਿਸਿ ਬਾਦੰ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Parbhati - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: But your gaze is evil, and your nights are wasted in conflict. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: krūr disat ratā nis bādan .1. rahāu .

translation.text: wear two loin-cloths, perform religious rituals and put only milk in your mouth.

translation.text: Without the True Guru, you shall not find the Way. ||5||1||
